summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms its commitment to the peace process in Colombia, recalling its resolutions and statements on the matter, particularly resolution 2655 (2022) which mandated the UN Verification Mission in Colombia until 31 October 2023.

Decides to expand the Verification Mission's mandate to monitor and verify the ceasefire between the Government of Colombia and the Ejército de Liberación Nacional (ELN) as outlined in the Second Cuba Agreement, authorizing up to 68 additional international observers and a civilian component.

Expresses willingness to consider mandating the Verification Mission to monitor and verify a ceasefire agreement between the Government of Colombia and the Estado Mayor Central (EMC) when a ceasefire with verification protocols is reached.

Welcomes the Secretary-General's proposal to report on the additional tasks within the existing quarterly reporting cycle and to keep the Council informed on the situation, including the humanitarian impact of the ceasefire.
